title: The Fed Chose an ‘Ounce of Prevention’ With Latest Rate Cut. Expect a Few More.
text:
More than any eminent economist, Benjamin Franklin seems to be guiding the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy. And that’s a good thing.

Among his many aphorisms, old Ben said “an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure,” wisdom that Fed Chairman Jerome Powell and his fellow central bankers apparently followed at the Sept. 17-18 meeting of the Federal Open Market Committee, according to minutes released Wednesday.
